snippet: To the Editor:    Re ''Setting the Sextant Aside'' (editorial, May 22): Just as electronics may have replaced celestial navigation at the Naval Academy, the teaching of astronomy in elementary and middle schools seems to be going backward....
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Setting the Sextant Aside'' (editorial, May 22): Just as electronics may have replaced celestial navigation at the Naval Academy, the teaching of astronomy in elementary and middle schools seems to be going backward.
abstract: Williams College Prof Jay M Pasachoff letter comments on May 22 editorial; contends that just as electronics may have replaced celestial navigation at Naval Academy, teaching of astronomy in elementary schools seems to be going backward
